headline: Martin Marietta Materials, Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 01, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, just 3 quick questions, if I could, from me. First one, just to help with the model building. Ratliff was a joint venture. Were you consolidating half of the 1.1 million cubic yards or was it not being consolidated at all before hand? Secondly, Ward,
componenttext: Yes, just 3 quick questions, if I could, from me. First one, just to help with the model building. Ratliff was a joint venture. Were you consolidating half of the 1.1 million cubic yards or was it not being consolidated at all before hand? Secondly, Ward, I think when you were talking about the reduction in guidance in the Cement business, you talked about the higher proportion of internal sales. I would have thought you kind of transferred those across the market price or am I misunderstanding the point you were making there? So maybe just a bit more explanation on that point. And then there were no share buybacks in the quarter. Maybe are you able to comment on why that might have been the case given what the share price did? Was it because you thought you may have to reduce the guidance and therefore, it wasn't appropriate to do it? Are you able to say anything on that?

headline: Martin Marietta Materials, Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 01, 2016
componenttextpreview: Michael is trying to say something in all 3 of those. How about that? Here is what I would say, on the Ratliff piece, no, we weren't consolidating on that.
componenttext: Michael is trying to say something in all 3 of those. How about that? Here is what I would say, on the Ratliff piece, no, we weren't consolidating on that.

headline: Martin Marietta Materials, Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 01, 2016
componenttextpreview: No. It was a nonconsolidated entity and all of its tonnage would have been included in external tons. So then now they're included in internal tons.
componenttext: No. It was a nonconsolidated entity and all of its tonnage would have been included in external tons. So then now they're included in internal tons.

headline: Martin Marietta Materials, Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 01, 2016
componenttextpreview: Relative to transfer pricing, Mike, to your question, we transferred market. And so I can answer that directly to you. And relative to the share buybacks, what I can tell is, we have this bad habit. We joke about it, we try to do exactly what we said we'r
componenttext: Relative to transfer pricing, Mike, to your question, we transferred market. And so I can answer that directly to you. And relative to the share buybacks, what I can tell is, we have this bad habit. We joke about it, we try to do exactly what we said we're going to do. And as we think back to what we said, we wanted to maintain that debt-to-EBITDA ratio of 2x, but we've also said that our first priority is doing the right transactions. So if you look at where we ended the quarter and if you look at the transaction that we did and if you look at where it left our ratio, it was exactly where we said we wanted to be. So what I would tell you is, if people are listening to our words, there should be no surprise on that. So that was the driver of the lack of share buybacks in Q3.

headline: Martin Marietta Materials, Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 01, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then lastly, are there any other major joint ventures that you have that could be in a similar situation to Ratliff?
componenttext: Okay. And then lastly, are there any other major joint ventures that you have that could be in a similar situation to Ratliff?

componenttextpreview: No. There are not any other major ones that I would anticipate having a similar conversation around.
componenttext: No. There are not any other major ones that I would anticipate having a similar conversation around.

headline: Martin Marietta Materials, Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 01, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thanks, again, for joining our third quarter 2016 earnings call. We are excited about the future of Martin Marietta, and we are in a very advantageous position through our superior geographic locations in markets that continue to experience strong employm
componenttext: Thanks, again, for joining our third quarter 2016 earnings call. We are excited about the future of Martin Marietta, and we are in a very advantageous position through our superior geographic locations in markets that continue to experience strong employment growth. The favorable construction outlook with significant pricing opportunities still to come will benefit this company for many years. Martin Marietta's focused execution of its strategic plan should provide a firm foundation to enhance long-term shareholder value. We very much look forward to discussing our full year results with you in February. Thank you for your time and support of Martin Marietta.

headline: Martin Marietta Materials, Inc., Q3 2016 Earnings Call, Nov 01, 2016
